column1: Silima was the substance invented by Fëanor to create the Silmarils. It was crystalline and unbreakable.
The ingredients of silima were known only to Fëanor
column2: though it was said to be made of the blended light of the Two Trees of Valinor.  It suffused the crystalline structure of the jewels and gave them a radiance that shone even in the dark
column3: yet gleamed more brightly when exposed to light.

column1: The name is Quenya and contains the element sil = "shine (white)"
Robert Foster suggests the meaning "Shining substance made by craft"
